item.title: When the Hittite kingdom fell, what political structure emerged in Anatolia?

itemmetadata.qmd_topic: McKay, History of Western Society 11e Launch Pad\Chapter 1

material.mattext: A. Theocratic states emerged based around religious shrines.
B. City assemblies of free men worked together under a king.
C. Nobles established individual domains under their absolute authority.
D. Military chieftains established nomadic bands of warriors and their families to raid the countryside.

item.title: How did the nobles in Sumerian society maintain their dominant position?

itemmetadata.qmd_topic: McKay, History of Western Society 11e Launch Pad\Chapter 1

material.mattext: A. They controlled access to the religious shrines and temples and denied religious rights to anyone who challenged their authority.
B. They possessed the land and permitted their clients to work parts of it, making the clients dependent on them.
C. They had exclusive political rights over public affairs, while the commoners were denied even the right to voice their opinions.
D. They held the right to tax all commercial transactions, gaining wealth and power over their opponents.

respcondition.title: 0 A. They controlled access to the religious shrin

displayfeedback.linkrefid: 0 A. They controlled access to the religious shrin

displayfeedback.linkrefid: 2 C. They had exclusive political rights over publ

respcondition.title: 3 D. They held the right to tax all commercial tra

displayfeedback.linkrefid: 3 D. They held the right to tax all commercial tra

material.mattext: The correct answer is B. Section: Civilization in Mesopotamia

itemfeedback.ident: 1 B. They possessed the land and permitted their c

material.mattext: Correct. Section: Civilization in Mesopotamia

material.mattext: The correct answer is B. Section: Civilization in Mesopotamia

item.title: How did a new form of regional politics emerge after the Hittite defeat of the Egyptians at the Battle of Kadesh?

B. The Hittites allied with the Babylonians to divide Egypt between them and rule it as a common protectorate.
C. The Hittites slaughtered the Egyptian ruling class and imposed domination through a puppet pharaoh.
D. The Hittites, Egyptians, and Babylonians formed an alliance to uphold one another’s authority and mutual protection.
